conclusion: Liquid will flow out from A, B, and C and needs to be tracked to determine which container (D or E) it flows into.
Source A is located at the top left corner, Source B is in the middle top, and Source C is at the top right corner.
Container D is located on the far left at the bottom, and container E is located on the far right at the bottom.
The blue baffle is angled to the right and positioned below Source A.
The black baffle is angled to the left and positioned below Source B.
The red baffle is angled to the right and positioned below the black baffle.
Source C does not encounter any baffles and flows straight downward.

premise: Liquid from Source A flows downward and encounters the blue baffle, which is angled to the right.
conclusion: Liquid from Source A is deflected to the right by the blue baffle.

premise: Liquid from Source A is deflected to the right by the blue baffle and encounters the orange baffle, which is also angled to the right.
conclusion: Liquid from Source A continues moving rightward after encountering the orange baffle.

premise: Liquid from Source A continues moving rightward and reaches the bottom.
conclusion: Liquid from Source A flows into container D.

premise: Liquid from Source B flows downward and encounters the black baffle, which is angled to the left.
conclusion: Liquid from Source B is deflected to the left by the black baffle.

premise: Liquid from Source B is deflected to the left by the black baffle and encounters the red baffle, which is angled to the right.
conclusion: Liquid from Source B moves rightward after encountering the red baffle.

premise: Liquid from Source B moves rightward and reaches the bottom.
conclusion: Liquid from Source B flows into container E.

premise: Liquid from Source C flows straight downward without encountering any baffles.
conclusion: Liquid from Source C flows directly into container E.
